comment:
I agree with most the things he says when he descibe the problems of the current internet.
I also agree about some of the values of Blockchain technology he describe but a lot of the things he describe are somewhere between gemagogy and lies.

comment: admittedly a bit too dramatic for my taste, the full movie that is avialable in this link: https://rumble.com/v56qjoy-climate-change-hoax-scam-of-a-century-new-movie.html presents the science that back up the people who say that likely there is no climate emergency, in detail i didn't see before . featuring some very prominent scientists that were proffesors at prestigous universities like harvard mit and caltech including a nobel prize winner physicist. i should add that if you put the name of the movie in google you can get many critics of it and it may be also intresting to read some of those articles for a balanced view.

rate.title: The BEST Banana Pudding Recipe EVER! - Mom On Timeout

comment:
I feel increasingly guilty as I make this for family gatherings, but it is truly a favorite, and I tell myself that it is after all, just once a year or so that I am serving this to people. (it cannot even remotely be called healthy). 
I don't use any of the banana flavored pudding in my version, and I accidentally bought and used a cheesecake pudding once, which was really good.

rate.comment: I've read 3 books by Dr. John Sarno. This 20/20 segment about his approache provides a very entertaining version.

comment: this is very intresting video indeed. from the period of the corona restrictions my confidence in doctors plumetted somewhat. i also think that money can sway medical decisions but i don't know to what extent. i would be openminded to hear this doctor lectures nowdays if i had a terrible back pain for sure.

rate.title: A Revolution in Thought? - Dr Iain McGilchrist

comment: this video is about the function of the right and left hemisphere based on scientific evidence from brain injuries of people and other kinds of data. it connects it to the rising totalitarian regimes that are starting to pop up in the west and the distancing of the people from nature and the rise of machines. it was a new prespective to me so was very thought provoking.

otherSubject.title: Big Vape: The Rise and Fall of Juul

comment:
this article was recommended by a doctor that i followed sometimes on substack that is called pierre kory  (some references appears to say he is also associate professor of medicine but couldn't see it on wikipedia).

it explains specific tactics that the tabacco industry used back in the 1950 to misinform and decieve the public. he said that he saw the same tactics being used on off label drugs (i wrote initially off the shelf but actually its wrong use of english and wrong i think) like ivermectin to discredit them in the period of the corona pandemic.
